summary: The document is a confidential FBI memorandum dated 11/19/65, concerning Ernst Friedrich Haas, an Austrian national who entered the US in January 1963 as the husband of an American citizen. Haas, a photographer associated with Magnum Photos, Inc., was evaluated under the ALEM Program for potential KGB Illegal Agent criteria. The assessment concluded that he did not meet the criteria, leading to the case's closure without further investigation.
key_findings: Ernst Friedrich Haas entered the US in January 1963 as the husband of an American citizen.
Haas was an Austrian national who last resided in France and listed his occupation as a photographer.
The document assesses Haas's potential as a KGB Illegal Agent under the ALEM Program but concludes he does not meet the criteria.
The case was closed with no further investigation recommended.
